1. What is a shell script?
Option B: b) a file containing special symbols
Option C: c) a file containing a series of commands
Explanation: Explanation: When we have to execute a series of commands altogether, we store them in a file which is itself executed as a shell script. A shell script is basically a computer program designed to be run by the UNIX shell.

Question: 2. Shell scripts need to be saved with an extension .sh .a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: It’s not mandatory to save script files with .sh extension but we do so for our own convention as it makes it easy to match them with wildcards.

Question: 3. Shell scripts are executed in a separate child shell process.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Shell scripts are executed in a separate child process, and this sub-shell need not be of the same type as our login shell. In other words, even if our login shell is bourne, we can use a Korn sub-shell to run our script.

Question: 4. The first line in any shell script begins with a _____
Explanation: Explanation: When the comment character (#) is placed anywhere in a line; the shell ignores all characters on its right. However, this rule doesn’t apply to the first line which is the interpreter line. It always begins with #! and followed by the pathname of the shell to be used for running the script.#!/bin/sh                   // first line defining the pathname# script.sh                // name of the script

Question: 5. To run the script, we should make it executable first by using _____
Explanation: Explanation: Before we run the script, it is essential to make the script executable first. After that invoke the script name to run the script. For making the script executable, we have to use chmod +x script_name.

Question: 6. To spawn a child of our own choice for running the script, we can use ___ command.
Explanation: Explanation: We know that shell scripts are executed by a child shell. But we can also explicitly spawn a child of our own choice by using the sh command along with script name as an argument. When used in this way, the interpreter line is ignored by the shell.

Question: 7. Which command is used for making the scripts interactive?
Explanation: Explanation: read command is used for making scripts interactive. It is used for taking input from the user. Input supplied from the keyboard is entered into the variable used with the read command. For example,#!/bin/sh                # emp.shecho ”enter your name”read Uname                  //read input from the userecho $Uname                // display input entered by the user

Question: 8. read command is shell’s internal tool.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: read command is the shell’s internal tool for taking input from the user i.e. it makes the scripts interactive.

Question: 9. A single read statement can be used with one or more variables.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: A single read statement can be used with one or more variables to let us enter multiple arguments. For example,read FirstName  LastName

Question: 10. What are positional parameters?
Option A: a) special variables for assigning arguments from the command line
Option C: c) special variables for reading user input
Explanation: Explanation: Shell scripts can also take input from command line. When arguments are specified with a shell script, they are assigned to certain special variables called positional parameters.

Question: 11. The first argument is read by the shell into the parameter ___
Explanation: Explanation: Command line arguments are stored into positional parameters. The first argument is read by the shell into the parameter $1, second argument in $2 and so on.

Question: 12. The complete set of positional parameters is stored in ______ as a single string.
Explanation: Explanation: There are some special parameters used by the shell. One of which is $*, which stores the complete set of positional parameters as a single string.

Question: 13. Which of the following is used for storing the number of positional parameters?
Explanation: Explanation: $# is used for storing the number of arguments specified. It lets us design scripts that check whether the right number of arguments have been entered. Explanation: Explanation: The if and else statement makes two-way decisions depending on the fulfilment of certain criteria. These statements are used in UNIX as they are used in other programming languages. For example,If command is successfulThen    Execute commandElse    Execute commandFi

Question: 6.  Every if is closed with a corresponding ____
Explanation: Explanation: if and else statements are used for making two-way decisions. Every if is closed with the corresponding fi. If we don’t do this we’ll encounter an error.

Explanation: Explanation: if-else statements makes two-way decisions depending on the fulfilment of certain conditions. But if we want to check more than two conditions we can use elif statement. Explanation: Explanation: There are some special parameters used by the shell. One of which is $0 which stores the name of the program.

Question: 8. ____ option is used for checking whether a particular file is older than a specified file.
Explanation: Explanation: If we have two file namely file01 and file02 and we want to check if file01 is older than file02, we have to use -ot option with test. The syntax is file01 -ot  file02. Question: 7. Which command is used  for computation and string handling?
Explanation: Explanation: The bourne shell can check whether an integer is greater than another or not, but it doesn’t have any computing features at all. It has to rely totally on expr command for that purpose. This command performs two functions:•    Performs arithmetic operations on integers•    Manipulates strings

Question: 8. expr can perform ____ arithmetic operations.
Explanation: Explanation: expr command can perform four basic arithmetic operations as well as the modulus function. For example,$ x=5  y=10$ expr $x + $y$ expr $x - $y$ expr $x /* $y        // asterisk has to escaped$ expr $y / $x$ expr $y % $x

Option A: a) determine the length of string
Option C: c) locate the position of a character in a string
Option D: d) determine the length of string, extract and locate the position of the string
Explanation: Explanation: Though expr’s string handling features are not that elegant, bourne shell users hardly have any choice. For evaluating strings expr uses two expressions separated by a colon.

Question: 10. The string to be worked upon is placed on the left of the colon when using expr string handling function.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: For evaluating strings expr uses two expressions separated by a colon. The string to be worked upon is placed on the left of the colon while a regular expression is placed on its right.

Question: 11. Which symbol is used for finding the length of the string?
Explanation: Explanation: The length of the string can be extracted using .* . This regular expression signifies to expr that it has to display the number of characters matching the pattern i.e. the length of the entire string. For example,$ expr “sanfoundry” :  ‘.*’10

Question: 12. Which of the following pattern is used for extracting a substring using expr?
Explanation: Explanation: expr can extract a substring enclosed by the escaped characters \ ( and \). For example, to extract ‘03’ from the string 2003 use the following command:$ str= 2003$ expr “$str” :  ‘. .\(. .\)’03

Question: 13. For locating the first position of a character in a string we can use expr command.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: expr command can also locate the first occurrence of character inside a string. For example, to locate the position of character d in the string ‘abdullah’, we have to count the number of characters which are not ‘d’ ([^d]*),$ str=abdullah ; expr “$str”  :  ‘[^d]*d’3

Question: 14. expr is an _____ command
Explanation: Explanation: expr command is an external command.

Question: 1. Which of the following commands let us perform a set of instructions repeatedly?
Explanation: Explanation: For repeatedly performing a set of instructions, we have to use loops. Shell features three types of loops —while, for and until. All of them repeat the instruction set enclosed by certain keywords.

Question: 2. Which of the following keywords are used in while loop?
Explanation: Explanation: while loop repeatedly performs a set of instructions until the control command returns a true exit status. The general syntax for while loop is:while  condition is truedo   commandsdone

Question: 3. until loop operates with a reverse logic as used in while loop.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Shell also offers an until statement which operates with a reverse logic used in while. With until the loop body is executed as long as the condition remains false.

Question: 4. Which one of the following is used for looping with a list?
Explanation: Explanation: The shell’s for loop differs in structure as used in C. for loop doesn’t test a condition but it uses a list instead. The syntax for using for loop is:for variable in listdo    commandsdone

Question: 5. Which of the following loop statements uses do and done keyword?
Explanation: Explanation: Like while loop, for also uses the keywords do and done, but the additional parameters used in for are variables and list.

Explanation: Explanation: basename command is used for changing the extensions of a group of filenames. It extracts the “base” filename from an absolute filename. Question: 7. Which command is used by the shell for manipulating positional parameters?
Explanation: Explanation: set statement is an internal command which assigns its arguments to positional parameters $1, $2 and so on. For example, the following command will assign the value 1345 to $1 and 5678 to $2,$ set 1345  5678$ _$ echo “\$1 is $1, \$2 is $2”$1 is 1345, $2 is 5678

Question: 8. ____ statement is used for shifting arguments left.
Explanation: Explanation: shift statement transfers the content of a positional parameter to its immediate lower numbered one. This process continues as many times as shift is invoked. For example, when called once, $2 becomes $1 and $3 becomes $2 and so on.$ echo “[email protected]”Wed Jan 8 09:48:44 IST 2017$ echo $1 $2 $3Wed Jan 8$ shift$ echo $1 $2 $3Jan 8 09:48:44        // parameters shifted

Question: 9. Which one of the following is an internal command?
Explanation: Explanation: set statement is an internal command which assigns its arguments to positional parameters $1, $2 and so on. While cut, Is and expr are external commands.

Question: 10. Which symbol is used with the set command for command substitution?
Explanation: Explanation: set statement can also be used for command substitution. There can be a problem especially when the output of the command begins with a – .It may happen that set interprets it as an option. To avoid this condition, we have to use — (double hyphen) immediately after set. For example,$ set -- `ls -lfile01`        //first - now taken care of

Question: 11. The ____ allows us to read data from the same file containing the script.
Explanation: Explanation: It may happen that the data our program wants to read is fixed and limited. The shell uses << symbol to read data from the same file containing the script. This is referred to as a here document, signifying that the data is here rather than in a separate file.

Question: 12. Any command using standard input can take the input from here document.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The shell uses >> symbol to read data from the same file containing the script. This is referred to as a here document. It allows any command (which uses standard input) to take input from it.

Question: 13. Which of the following command doesn’t accept a filename as an argument?
Explanation: Explanation: The mailx command doesn’t accept any filename as its argument. So if we want to give input to the mailx command, we can use the here document.

Question: 14. We can use the here document with interactive programs also.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Many commands require input from the user. So we can use the here document with interactive programs also. In this manner, we can instruct any script to take the input non-interactively by supplying the input using the here document. For example,$ empone.sh <<END        //empone.sh is a script>manager>emp.lst            > ENDHence by using the above commands, we can search for the pattern ‘manager’ in emp.lst .

Question: Hence by using the above commands, we can search for the pattern ‘manager’ in emp.lst .
15.  ____ command is the appropriate way to interrupt a program.
Explanation: Explanation: Any shell script is terminated when the interrupt key is pressed. But this is not the appropriate way of doing so. For interrupting any program we should use the trap command.

Option C: c) $0 was used in the script
Explanation: Explanation: A shell script will stop running when we change its name if we’d used the positional parameter $0 in it as $0 contains the name of the script file.

Question: 5. Where is the exit status of a command stored?
Explanation: Explanation: The exit status of a command is that particular value which is returned by the command to its parent. This value is stored in $?.

Question: 1. The system administrator is also known as _____
Explanation: Explanation: The system administrator has access to huge powers. This entrusted person is also known as the root user or superuser.

Question: 2. Which of the following functionalities is carried by the root user?
Option C: c) changing attributes of a file
Option D: d) managing disk space, performing backup, changing attributes of a file
Explanation: Explanation: superuser or the root user has access to vast powers like he/she is responsible for managing the disk space, performing backups, changing attributes of files, maintaining user accounts etc.

Question: 3. What is the login name of system administrator?
Explanation: Explanation: UNIX provides a special login name for system administrator i.e. root. This account doesn’t need to be created separately but comes with every system. The password for the root user is set at the time of installation.

Question: 4. What is the prompt for system administrator?
Explanation: Explanation: The prompt of the root user is # whereas the prompt for normal users or non-privileged users is % or $.

Question: 5. When we log in as root user we are placed in ____
Explanation: Explanation: When we log in to the system as root user we are normally placed in the root’s home directory. Depending on the system we are using this directory can be / or /root.

Question: 6. The PATH for superuser doesn’t include current directory.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Since we know that the superuser has to constantly navigate through the file system, it may happen that he/she unintentionally execute the scripts or programs written by other users. That’s why the PATH for a superuser doesn’t include the current directory.

Question: 7. Which command is used for acquiring superuser status?
Explanation: Explanation: Any user can acquire the status of superuser by using the su command. The only condition that needs to be fulfilled here is, he/she must be aware of the root password. For example,$ suPassword: *****        //root’s password#pwd/home/abd             //prompt changes ( super user mode)

Question: 8. Which of the following is used for creating user’s environment?
Explanation: Explanation: The administrator can create a simulated environment using su – for any user. This command creates the user’s environment without taking the login-password route. For example,$ su - abdAbove command will execute abd’s .profile and creates a temporary abd’s environment.

Question: Above command will execute abd’s .profile and creates a temporary abd’s environment.
9. User’s environment mode created using su – is terminated using ____
Explanation: Explanation: The administrator can create a simulated environment using su – for any user. This mode runs a separate sub-shell and is terminated using ctrl-d or exit.

Question: 10. Which command is used by the system administrator to set the date of the system?
Explanation: Explanation: date command is used by users for displaying the system date. Same command is used by the system administrator to change/set the system date. The argument is an eight-character string of the form MMDDhhmm. For example,# date 08122134Sun Aug  12 21:34:00 IST 2018

Question: 11. ____ command allows superuser to communicate with users.
Explanation: Explanation: The wall command can be used by the administrator to address all users simultaneously. For example,# wallKindly everyone shut down the system before leaving the lab.[ctrl-d]All the users currently logged in will receive this message on their terminal.

Question: 12. ____ command is used for setting limits on file size.
Explanation: Explanation: The ulimit command is used for imposing a restriction on the maximum size of the file that a user is permitted to create on the system.  For example,# ulimit  209788        // measured in 512-byte locks

Question: 13. The access to the use of at and batch is restricted and controlled by ___ and ____
Explanation: Explanation: The access to the use of at and batch is restricted and controlled by the files at.allow and at.deny. If at.allow is present, only those users which are listed in this file can use at and batch. If this file is not present then the system checks at.deny for users who are blocked from using these commands.

Question: 14. If both at.allow and at.deny are not present, only the system administrator can access at and batch command.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The access to the use of at and batch is restricted and controlled by the files at.allow and at.deny. If at.allow is present, only those users which are listed in this file can use at and batch. If this file is not present then the system checks at.deny for users who are blocked from using these commands. If neither file is present, only the administrator can invoke at and batch.

Question: 15. ____ command is used by the superuser for changing root’s password.
Explanation: Explanation: The pswd command prompts for existing password when this command is used by a non-privileged user but when the same command is used by the superuser it behaves much leniently and doesn’t ask for the old password this time. For example,# pswd/* diagnostic messages displayed */New-password : ******Re-enter password: ******Password Changed

Question: 1. The SUID for any file can be set by the administrator using ____
Explanation: Explanation: The SUID (set-user-ID) lets a process have the privileges of the owner of the file during the instance of the program. Question: 2. The superuser can set the sticky bit.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The sticky bit (also called the saved text bit) when applied to a regular file ensures that the text image of the program with the bit set is permanently kept in the swap area. The sticky bit also comes with a security feature when applied to directories. To apply the sticky bit to a directory superuser can use 1 as the additional bit with chmod in the following manner:# chmod  1775  dirone# ls  -l  a.txtdrwxrwxr-t  2     abd     dialin     2048   Apr 23  09:04   Dirone

Question: 3. Which of the following commands are used for maintenance of user accounts?
Explanation: Explanation: For the creation and maintenance of user accounts, UNIX provides to the superuser three commands —useradd, usermod and userdel.

Question: 4. _____ command is used for creating a new group.
Explanation: Explanation: groupadd command allows us to create a new group. For example, to create a group named OFFICEMANAG with a GID (group ID) of 398, use the following command:groupadd -g 398  OFFICEMANAG

Question: 5.  For adding a new user to the system, we have to use ____ command.
Explanation: Explanation: The useradd command is used to add new users to the system. Question: 6. All the user information is stored in _____
Explanation: Explanation: All the user information except the password encryption is stored in /etc/passwd. The encryption itself is stored in /etc/shadow. There are seven fields in /etc/passwd.

Question: 7. Which of the following is not a field stored in /etc/passwd?
Explanation: Explanation: The password encryption itself is stored in /etc/shadow while there are seven fields in /etc/passwd namely:•    Username•    Password•    UID•    GID•    GCOS•    HOME directory•    Login shell

Question: 8.  Which command is used by the administrator to modify some parameters of existing users?
Explanation: Explanation: usermod command is used for modifying some parameters set with useradd. For example, sometimes users need to change their login shell, to do so root user will invoke the following command:# usermod  -s  /bin/bash   oracle        //sets bash as the login shell for user oracle

Question: 9. userdel is used for removing users from the system.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: We can remove users from the system using the userdel command. To remove a particular user from the system, use the following command:# userdel  oracle    // remove user amed oracle from system but doesn’t delete his files

Question: 10. shutdown command is used by the administrator for shutting down the system.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The system administrator is also responsible for shutting down the system. For this purpose, shutdown command is used. This command performs various activities before shutting the system.

Question: 11. Which option is used with shutdown command to override the default waiting time?a) -gb) -eb) -sd) -iView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: -g option is used with shutdown command to override the default waiting time (one minute). For example,shutdown  -g2            // shut down the machine after 2 minutes

Question: 12. Which one of the following command will shutdown and reboot the system?
Explanation: Explanation: -y option is used with shutdown command for shutting the system immediately. Similarly, we can use the shutdown command to turn the machine off in various ways. To shut down and reboot the system, use the following command:shutdown -y -g0 -i6.

Question: 13. Which command is used for reporting free space on the disk?
Explanation: Explanation: As we know that, UNIX OS is supported by various multiple file systems. The df (disk free) command reports the amount of space available for each file system separately.

Question: 14. ___ option is used with df command for displaying the total amount of disk space in the file system.
Explanation: Explanation: The -t (total) option when used with df command displays free space on each file system as well as the total amount of disk space in the file system.

Question: 15.  ___ option is used with df command for displaying the total amount of disk space in the file system in terms of Kilobytes.
Explanation: Explanation: The df (disk free) command reports the amount of space available for each file system separately. -k option is used with df command for displaying the total amount of disk space in the file system in terms of Kilobytes.

Question: 1. Which command is used to find out the consumption of a specific directory?
Explanation: Explanation: Sometimes, we may need to find out the consumption of a specific directory rather than an entire file system. For this purpose, du command is used. This command reports usage by recursive examination of the directory structure.

Question: 2. Which option is used with du command for finding only the summary of disk usage by a specific directory?
Explanation: Explanation: If we use the du command, then by default it displays the usage of each subdirectory of its argument along with a summary at the end. If we want to display only summary then we can use -s option with du command. For example,# du  -s  /home/user10/doc78954    /home/user10/doc

Question: 3. du command can also be used for reporting the disk space consumed by each user.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Most of the dynamic space in the system is consumed by users, their directories and files. We can use the following command if we want to know the disk space consumed by each user.# du  -s  /home/*

Question: 4. A device file contains no data.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: A device file is a file which is built into the kernel for each and every device of the system. Whenever we open a device, read or write to it, all these functions are performed using device files.

Question: 5. All the device files are stored in _____
Explanation: Explanation: A device file is a file which is built into the kernel for each and every device of the system. All the device files are stored in /dev or in its subdirectories. To view the list of device files on your system, use the following command:# ls  -l  /dev

Question: 6. The set of routines needed to operate a specific device is known as ________
Explanation: Explanation: The set of routines needed to operate a specific device is known as a device driver. Whenever a particular device is accessed, the kernel calls the correct device driver and passes some parameters to it.

Question: 7. For formatting diskettes, we can use the _______ command.
Explanation: Explanation: Before backing up data to a floppy, we may need to format it. For this purpose, either format or fdformat command is used (whichever is supported by your system).

Question: 8. ___ command performs copying of diskettes.
Explanation: Explanation: dd (disk jump) command can be used in copying files systems, but is majorly used for copying media (floppies and tapes).

Question: 9. Which of the following is a backup program?
Explanation: Explanation: As a system administrator, you are responsible for creating a backup of the data which resides on your system. For this purpose, there are mainly two backup programs which are extensively used i.e. cpio and tar. The cpio command copies files to and from a backup device.

Question: 10. cpio program can be used with redirection and piping.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The cpio command copies files to and from a backup device. It uses the standard input for taking the list of filenames and then copies them with their content and header to standard output which can also be redirected to a file or a device. Hence, cpio can be used with redirection and piping.

Question: 11. Which of the following options are used with the cpio program?
Explanation: Explanation: cpio command uses two key options, -o (output) and -i (input). The -o option is used for backing up files while the -i option is used for restoring files.

Question: 12. tar command uses ___ option for backing up files.
Explanation: Explanation: The tar (tape archive) command is more powerful than cpio command. For creating a backup using tar, we have to use the -c option. For example,# tar -cvf  /dev/rdsk/f0987yu   /home/user/doc/SQL

Question: 13. For restoring files using tar, ____ option is used.
Explanation: Explanation: Files can be restored using -x option with the tar command. When no file or directory is specified it restores all the files from the backup device.# tar  -xvf  /dev/rdsk/f0987yu

Question: 14. For displaying the archive, -t option is used with the tar command.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: -t option alike cpio is also used with tar command for displaying the archive. For example,# tar  -tvf  /dev/rdsk/f0987yu

Question: 15. tar command can use the standard input to obtain its file list.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: tar command cannot use the standard input to obtain its file list. It accepts only file and directory name as arguments.

Question: 1. Which filter apart from perl, is the most powerful?
Explanation: Explanation: The awk command made a later entry in the UNIX system. Like sed, it combines features of several filters. It is one of the most powerful filter after perl.

Question: 2. Awk filter operates at field level.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk filter can do several things, it operates on field level and can easily access, transform and format individual fields in a line.

Question: 3. Which of the following will be used to print lines containing ‘manager’ in emp.lst?
Explanation: Explanation: The syntax for using awk is:awk  options  ‘selection_criteria { action }’ file(s)

Question: 4. The default action if selection_criteria is missing is ____
Explanation: Explanation: If the selection_criteria is missing in awk command statement then the default action i.e. print is applied.

Question: 5. For pattern-matching, awk uses regular expressions in ____ style.
Explanation: Explanation: For pattern-matching, awk uses regular expressions in sed-style. For example,$ awk -F “|” ‘/sa[kx]s*ena/’  emp.lst

Question: 6. awk uses ______ for splitting a line into fields.
Explanation: Explanation: awk uses the special parameter $0 to indicate the entire line. It also uses $1, $2, $3 …. to identify fields. For example,$ awk -F “|” ‘/sales/ { print $2, $4, $6 }’  emp.lst          // prints 2nd, 4th and 6th field where pattern is matched

Question: 7.  Which built-in variable is used by the awk to specify the line numbers?
Explanation: Explanation: awk uses the built-in variable NR to specify line numbers. For example, to select lines 3 to 6 use the following command:$ awk  -F “|” ‘NR == 3, NR == 6 { print NR, $2, $4 }’ emp.lst

Question: 8. What is the default delimiter used by awk?
Explanation: Explanation: awk is the only filter which uses whitespace as the default delimiter instead of a single space or tab.

Question: 9. The printf function uses ___ for string data and ___ for numeric.
Explanation: Explanation: awk filter supports most of the formats used by the printf function in ‘C’ language. Here, %s format will be used for string and %d format for numeric.

Question: 10. awk doesn’t use $ in evaluation or assignment of variables.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk allows the use of user-defined variables but without declaring them. awk doesn’t use $ either in evaluation or in the assignment of a variable.X=”5”print X            // prints 5

Question: 11. A user-defined variable is initialized to ____
Explanation: Explanation: A user-defined variable needs no initialization. It is implicitly initialized to zero or null string and awk has a mechanism of identifying the type and initial value of a variable.

Question: 12. awk uses ___ operator for concatenating strings.
Explanation: Explanation: awk provides no operator for string concatenation. To do so, we have to simply put two strings side by side:x=”sanf” ; y=”com”print x y        // prints sanfcom

Question: 13. awk uses __ and __ as comparison operators.
Explanation: Explanation: awk uses the && and | | as logical operators in the same sense as used by the C. The following command looks  for two strings in third field only using || operator.$ awk  -F “|” ‘$3== “director” || $3== “manager” { printf “%-20s  %-12s  %d\n”, $2, $6}’ emp.lst

Question: 14. awk allows the user to use variables of his own choice.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk has certain built-in variables like $0, NR, it also permits the user to use variables of his own choice. For example, following command print the name of those directors having salary>6000.$ awk  -F “|” ‘$3== “director” || $6 > 6000 { > count=count+1>printf “%-20s  %d\n”, $2, $6}’ emp.lst

Question: 15. Which option is used for storing awk programs in a file?
Explanation: Explanation: We can store large awk programs in a separate file and provide them with a  .awk extension. For example,$ cat emp1.awk $3== “director” || $6 > 6000 { > count=count+1>printf “%-20s  %d\n”, $2, $6}File savedawk  -F “|” -f emp1.awk  emp.lst    // commands written in emp1.awk are executed on emp.lst

Question: 1. ____ section can be used if we’ve to print something before processing the first line.
Explanation: Explanation: awk statements are usually applied on all the lines selected by the address. But if we want to print something before processing the first line, for example, a heading, then the BEGIN section can be used. The syntax is:	advertisement	    freestar.queue.push(function () { googletag.display('SanFoundry_300x250_320x50_320x100_inlist1'); });	BEGIN {    action }

Question: 2. ____ section can be used if we’ve to print something after processing the last line.
Explanation: Explanation: awk statements are usually applied on all the lines selected by the address. But if we want to print something after processing the first line, for example, a footer, then the END section can be used. The syntax is:END {     action }

Question: 3. awk uses ____ for providing comments.
Explanation: Explanation: Like shell, awk also used the # symbol for providing comments. For example,	advertisement	    freestar.queue.push(function () { googletag.display('SanFoundry_300x250_320x50_320x100_inlist2'); });	BEGIN {    printf “\t\t employee data\n\n”}              # demonstration of BEGIN section - (this is a comment line)

Question: 4. Which of the following is a built-in variable for awk?
Explanation: Explanation: awk has several built-in variables like FS, OFS, NF each of which serves a different purpose.

Question: 5. FS defines the field separator.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: As we know that, awk uses a contiguous set of space as the default field delimiter. FS defines this field separator. For example,BEGIN { FS= “|” }         // | is the delimiter now

Question: 6. Which built variable is used for defining the field delimiter in the output?
Explanation: Explanation: The OFS variable is used for specifying the field delimiter in the output. For example,BEGIN { OFS= “~” }    // output fields will be separated with a tidle.

Question: 7. The ____ variable stores the name of the file currently being processed.
Explanation: Explanation: awk supports another built-in variable named FILENAME which stores the name of the file, currently being processed.

Question: 8. Which of the following is not a built-in variable used by awk?
Explanation: Explanation: argv is used for storing the list of arguments while argc stores the number of arguments in the command line.

Question: 9. awk supports the use of arrays.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk supports the use of arrays but awk arrays differ from those arrays used in another programming language. These arrays are accessed normally using an index.

Question: 10. Which of the following is not true about awk arrays?
Option A: a) they are not expanded automatically
Option B: b) they are initialized to zero or an empty string
Option C: c) index can be a string also
Option D: d) they are not formally defined
Explanation: Explanation: awk supports the use of arrays but awk arrays differ from those arrays used in another programming language. awk arrays are expanded automatically.

Question: 11. Which of the following is an associative array?
Explanation: Explanation: awk doesn’t treat array indices as integers. Awk arrays are associative (hash) arrays. Similarly, ENVIRON[ ] is also an associative array, known as environment array which is used to store all environment variables.

Question: 1. ____ function breaks up a string on the basis of delimiter.
Explanation: Explanation: The split function breaks a substr str on the basis of delimiter. The syntax is split (stg, arr, ch) where stg is the string to be broken, ch is delimeter and arr is the array which stores the fields.

Question: 2. For running a UNIX command within awk, we’ve to use ____ function.
Explanation: Explanation: For running a UNIX command within awk, we’ve to use system function. For example,BEGIN {      system(“date”)   // prints the system date }

Question: 3. sqroot(x) function returns the square root of x.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: The sqrt(x) function is used for returning the square root of x.

Question: 4. Which of the following is supported by awk?
Explanation: Explanation: awk generally supports all the functions and features of a modern programming language. It provides if condition for control flow and while, for loop for repeatedly executing the instructions.

Question: 5. print statement is necessary for printing a line.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: print statement is not necessary for printing a line. If the selection criteria is specified, the specified line is automatically printed.

Question: 6. awk uses _____ dimensional arrays.
Explanation: Explanation: awk supports one-dimensional arrays where the array subscript can be a string also.

Question: 7. awk has some built-in functions which are used for arithmetic and string operations.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk also has several built-in functions which are used for performing arithmetic as well as string operations. The arguments to these functions are passed in C style.

Question: 8. Which of the following is a built-in function for awk?
Explanation: Explanation: awk has several built-in functions which are used for performing arithmetic as well as string operations. The length function is used for determining the length of its argument while the index is used for determining the position of a string str1 within another string str2.

Question: 9. The _____ function extracts a substring from a string.
Explanation: Explanation: The substr function is used for extracting a substring from a string. The syntax for using this function is substr (str,m,n) where str is the string from which extraction is done. m represents the starting point of extraction and n indicates the number of characters to be extracted.

Question: 10. awk makes a distinction between numeric and string variables.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: awk has no procedure for a distinction between numeric and string variables. It can perform numeric computations for a string as well.

Question: 1. Which one of the following is the most powerful filter?
Explanation: Explanation: A perl is the finest filter used on the UNIX system and is the finest of all (grep, sed, awk, tr). In fact, it combines the power of these. There is nothing can these filters can do and perl can’t.

Question: 2. A perl program runs in a special interpretive mode.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: A perl program runs in a special interpretive mode; the entire script is first compiled internally before getting executed.

Question: 3. To test whether perl is in your PATH, use ____
Explanation: Explanation: Unlike other filters, script errors are generated before the execution of perl script file. To check whether perl exist on our system or not use this simple command:$ perl -e ‘print(“perl is present”) ;’

Question: 4. It is often more convenient to save perl program files with ____ extension.
Explanation: Explanation: perl programs are often very big, hence it is better to use .pl extension with perl program files.

Question: 5. ___ function is used for removing the last character from the line.
Explanation: Explanation: In many conditions, we may need to chop the last character –especially when there is a newline character. For this purpose, chop function is used.

Question: 6. perl variables have no type and no initialization.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Perl variables have no type and no initialization. Both the strings and numbers can be as large as our machine permits.

Question: 7. When a string is used for numeral computations, perl converts it into ___
Explanation: Explanation: There are some attributes which we should keep in mind while using perl. One of which is, when we use string for numerical comparison or computation, perl immediately converts it into a number.

Question: 8. If a variable is undefined, its value is ____
Explanation: Explanation: When a variable is undefined, it is assumed to be a NULL string and NULL string is numerically zero.

Question: 9. Which of the following are concatenation operators?
Explanation: Explanation: Like in shell, concatenation is performed by placing two variables side by side. This case is not followed with perl. Rather perl uses . (dot) operator for concatenating two variables. For example,$ perl  -e  ‘$x=san ; $y=”foundry” ; print($x . $y . );’sanfoundry

Question: 10. To repeat a string, perl uses ___ operator.
Explanation: Explanation: perl uses the x operator to repeat a string. For example, the following command will print * 10 times;$ perl  -e  ‘print “*” x 10 ;’**********

Question: 11. Which function is used by perl for displaying the length of a string?
Explanation: Explanation: The length function is used by perl to return the length of any string. For example,$x= “Abdullah”;print length($x);       // prints 8

Question: 12. ___ function returns the first occurrence of a character in a string.
Explanation: Explanation: The index function returns the first occurrence of a character in a string. For example,$x= “Abdullah”;print index($x,u);     // prints 3

Question: 13. For extracting a substring, ____ function is used.
Explanation: Explanation: The substr function extracts a particular substring from a string based on the value of specified indices. For example,$x= “abcdefghijklm”$y= substr( $x, -3,2);   // extracts two characters from the third position on the right sideprint “$y”;             // prints kl

Question: 14. substr function is also used to alter an existing string.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: substr function works in a versatile way. It can also be used for altering an existing string i.e. we can edit an existing string. For example,$x= “abcdijklm”substr($x,4,0)= “efgh” ;    // stuff $x with efgh without replacing any charcatersprint “$x” ;               //$x is now abcdefghijklm

Question: 15. Which function is used by perl for reversing a string?
Explanation: Explanation: The reverse function, which can operate on strings as well as arrays is used to reverse the characters in a string and return the reversed string. For example,$x= “abcd” ;print reverse($x) ;       / prints dcba

Question: 16. Which function is used for handling substitutions in perl?
Explanation: Explanation: The s and tr functions handle all substitutions in perl. The s command is used in same way as it was used in sed while tr is used translating the characters in the same way like the UNIX tr command does.

Question: 17. Which escape character is used for identifying a word character?
Explanation: Explanation: Perl offers some escaped characters to represent whitespace, digits and word boundaries. The most commonly used ones are:\s - a whitespace character\d - a digit\w - a word character

Question: 18. We can use find command for testing files with perl.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Perl can also be used with test command for various file tests. For example,$x = “abc.txt” ;print “File $x is readable\n” if -r $x ;

Question: 1. We can specify filenames in command line using perl.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: perl provides specific functions to open a file and perform I/O operations on it. The <> (diamond) operator is used for reading lines from a file. Question: 2. Which of the following is referred to as default variable?
Explanation: Explanation: perl assigns the line read from input to a special variable $_; often called default variable. This is an extremely important variable, which can make our code compact.

Question: 3. ___ operator is used for selecting current line number.
Explanation: Explanation: perl stores the current line number in a special variable $. ($ followed by a dot). We can use it to represent a line address and select lines from anywhere:Perl  -ne  ‘print if {$.  < 4}’ foo        // same as head  -n 3

Question: 4. ___ is known as range operator.
Explanation: Explanation: perl . . (range operator) is a counterpart of awk’s NR variable. For example,the following command prints 1,2,3,4,5for each(1..5) {  print “$_”;}

Question: 5. The command @x=(1. .10) will assign first ten integer values to the array ‘a’.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: Lists and arrays lie at the heart of perl. Perl has a large number of functions to manipulate them. For example, in the following we’ve assigned three values to array @month:@month =  {“jan”, “feb”, “march”} ;        //$month[1] is feb

Question: 6. The ___ prefix to an array name signifies the last index of the array.
Explanation: Explanation: The $# prefix to an array name signifies the last index of the array. It is always one less than the size of the array. For example,@month =  {“jan”, “feb”, “march”} ;$last_index = $#month;        //$last_index is “march”

Question: 7. For deleting the elements from the left of the array ___  function is used.
Explanation: Explanation: perl provides a handful of functions for manipulating the contents of an array. For example, perl uses shift function to delete the left-most element of an array.@list= (3. .5,9) ;    // this is 3,4,5,9shift(@list)         // now it is 4,5,9

Question: 8. For deleting the elements from the right of the array ___  function is used.
Explanation: Explanation: perl provides a handful of functions for manipulating the contents of any array. For example, perl uses the pop function to delete the right-most element of an array.@list= (3. .5,9) ;      // this is 3,4,5,9pop(@list)             // now it is 3,4,5

Question: 9. To add elements to the left side of the array ____ function is used.
Explanation: Explanation: Ta add elements to the left side of the array, use the unshift function. For example,@list= (5,9) ;                // this is 5,9unshift( @list,1. .3) ;      // now it becomes 1,2,3,5,9

Question: 10. To add elements to the right side of the array ____ function is used.
Explanation: Explanation: Ta add elements to the right side of the array, use the push function. For example,@list= (5,9) ;            // this is 5,9unshift( @list,13) ;     // now it becomes 5,9,13

Question: 11. Which function can combine the functionalities of push, pop, unshift and shift?
Explanation: Explanation: The splice function can perform all the four functions performed by these functions. It uses upto four arguments to add or remove elements at any location of the array. The second argument is the offset from where we’ve to perform insertion or deletion, the third argument represents the number of elements to be removed. If it is 0, elements are to be added. The fourth argument specifies the new replaced list. For example,@list= (1,2,3,4,5,9) ;splice(@list, 5, 0, 6. . 8);        //adds at 6th location -1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9

Question: 12. For looping in a list, ____ is used.
Explanation: Explanation: perl provides an extremely useful foreach construct to loop through a list. The syntax is,foreach $var (@arr) {   statements}

Question: 13. perl also supports use of for loop in the following manner.
a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: perl supports both foreach construct and for loop for looping purposes. For example,for($i=0;$i<3;$i++){print(“hello”) ; }        //print “Hello” three times

Question: 14. For splitting a line or expression into fields, __ is used.
Explanation: Explanation: split breaks a particular line or expression into fields. These fields are assigned either to variables or an array. For example,($var1, $var2, $var3 . . . ) = split(/sep/,stg) ;@arr= split(/sep/,stg) ;      // splits string stg on sep (sep can be literal character or regular expression)

Question: 15. ___ function is used for joining lists.
Explanation: Explanation: The join function acts in an opposite manner to split. It combines its arguments into a single string and uses the delimiter as the first argument. For example,$weekstr = join( “ “, @week_arr) ;@weekstr = join(“ “, “mon”, “tue”, “wed”);print $weekstr ;            // output will be mon, tue, wed

Question: 16. perl is ____ of grep, tr, sed and awk.
Explanation: Explanation: perl is a superset of grep, sed, awk and the shell. It can perform all the functions performed by all these and that too more efficiently.

Question: 1. An operator can’t perform any function without being combined with a command or itself.a) Trueb) FalseView Answer
Explanation: Explanation: An operator alone cannot perform any function unless it is combined with a command or itself. For example, by using dd or yy we can delete or copy a line respectively.

Question: 2. For deleting the line form current cursor to the end of the line, we can use:
